00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 """
00004 Known issues:
00005 
00006 - .jpg images created by the Vtk backend dosen't seem to work with the
00007   mencoder and ffmpeg tools. This can be fixed by setting the force_conversion
00008   argument to True. This will force conversion of the .jpg files to .png files
00009   which in turn should successfully create the movie.
00010 
00011 - apsect ratio in mpeg_encode doesn't seem to work.
00012 """
00013 
00014 import os, glob, re
00015 
00016 from graphics.miscUp import findprograms
00017 from misc import _check_type

00019 class MovieEncoder(object):
00020     _local_prop = {
00021         'input_files': None, 
00022         'output_file': None, 
00023         'overwrite_output': False,   # overwrite output file if true
00024         'encoder': None,             # default encoding tool
00025         'vbitrate': 800,             # default video bit rate
00026         'vbuffer': None,             # video buffer
00027         'fps': 25,                   # default frame rate
00028         'vcodec': 'mpeg4',           # default video codec
00029         'size': None,
00030         'quiet': False,
00031         'aspect': None,
00032         'prefered_package': 'ImageMagick',
00033         'qscale': None,
00034         'qmin': 2,
00035         'qmax': 31,
00036         'iqscale': None,
00037         'pqscale': None,
00038         'bqscale': None,
00039         'pattern': 'I',
00040         'gop_size': None,
00041         'force_conversion': False,
00042         }
00043     _legal_encoders = 'mencoder ffmpeg mpeg_encode ppmtompeg mpeg2enc'.split()
00044     _legal_file_types = 'png gif jpg ps eps bmp tif tga pnm'.split()
00045 
00046     def __init__(self, input_files, **kwargs):
00047         self._prop_prop = {}
00048         self._prop_prop.update(self._local_prop_local_prop)
00049         self._prop_prop['input_files'] = input_files
00050         for key in kwargs:
00051             if key in self._prop_prop:
00052                 self._prop_prop[key] = kwargs[key]
00053 
00054         # determine which encoder to be used:
00055         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00056         if encoder is None:
00057             for enc in self._legal_encoders_legal_encoders:
00058                 if findprograms(enc):
00059                     encoder = enc
00060                     break
00061             if encoder is None:
00062                 raise Exception, "None of the supported encoders is installed"
00063             self._prop_prop['encoder'] = encoder
00064         else:
00065             if not encoder in self._legal_encoders_legal_encoders:
00066                 raise ValueError, "encoder must be %s, not %s" % \
00067                       (self._legal_encoders_legal_encoders, encoder)
00068             if not findprograms(encoder):
00069                 raise Exception, "The selected encoder (%s) is not installed" \
00070                       % encoder
00071 
00072         # determine the file type of the input files:
00073         if isinstance(input_files, (tuple,list)):
00074             file_ = input_files[0]
00075         elif isinstance(input_files, str):
00076             file_ = input_files
00077         else:
00078             raise ValueError, "The input files must be given as either a "\
00079                   "list/tuple of strings or a string, not %s" % \
00080                   type(input_files)
00081         fname, ext = os.path.splitext(file_)
00082         if not ext:
00083             raise ValueError, "Unable to determine file type from file name."
00084         file_type = ext[1:] # remove the . (dot)
00085         if not file_type in self._legal_file_types_legal_file_types:
00086             raise TypeError, "file type must be %s, not '%s'" % \
00087                   (self._legal_file_types_legal_file_types, file_type)
00088         self._prop_prop['file_type'] = file_type
00089         
00090     def encode(self):
00091         """Encode a series of images to a movie."""
00092         # check that the selected encoder is legal:
00093         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00094         if not encoder in self._legal_encoders_legal_encoders:
00095             raise ValueError, "encoder must be one of %s, not '%s'" % \
00096                   (self._legal_encoders_legal_encoders, encoder)
00097 
00098         # get command string:
00099         exec('cmd=self._%s()' % encoder)
00100 
00101         # run command:
00102         if not self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00103             print "Running: \n\n%s\n" % cmd
00104         failure = os.system(cmd)
00105         if failure:
00106             print '\n\ncould not make movie'
00107         elif not self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00108             print "\n\nmovie in output file", self._prop_prop['output_file']
00109 
00110         # clean up temporary files:
00111         if hasattr(self, '_tmp_files'): 
00112             for tmp_file in self._tmp_files_tmp_files:
00113                 os.remove(tmp_file)
00114 
00115     def _mencoder(self):
00116         """Create a string with commands for creating a movie with the
00117         mencoder encoding program.
00118         """
00119         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00120         cmd = encoder
00121         file_type = self._prop_prop['file_type']
00122         files = self._prop_prop['input_files']
00123         if isinstance(files, str):
00124             pattern = r'(.*)%(\d+)d(.*\..*)'
00125             match = re.search(pattern, files)
00126             if match:
00127                 pre = match.group(1)
00128                 num = int(match.group(2))
00129                 ext = match.group(3)
00130                 files = pre + '[0-9]'*num + ext
00131             files = glob.glob(files)
00132             if not files:
00133                 raise ValueError, \
00134                       "%s is not a valid file specification or the files "\
00135                       "doesn't exist." % self._prop_prop['input_files']
00136         if isinstance(files, (list,tuple)):
00137             if not file_type in ['jpg', 'png'] or \
00138                    self._prop_prop['force_conversion']:
00139                 # since mencoder only supports jpg and png files, we have to
00140                 # create copies of the input files and convert them to jpg.
00141                 files = self._any2any_any2any(files, ofile_ext='.png')
00142                 file_type = 'png'
00143                 self._tmp_files_tmp_files = files[:] # store files for later removal
00144             # give the files as a comma separated string to mencoder:
00145             files = ','.join(files)
00146         cmd += ' "mf://%s" -mf' % files
00147         cmd += ' fps=%g' % float(self._prop_prop['fps'])
00148         cmd += ':type=%s' % file_type
00149         vbitrate = self._prop_prop['vbitrate']
00150         vcodec = self._prop_prop['vcodec']
00151         qscale = self._prop_prop['qscale']
00152         qmin = self._prop_prop['qmin']
00153         qmax = self._prop_prop['qmax']
00154         vbuffer = self._prop_prop['vbuffer']
00155         if vcodec == 'xvid':
00156             cmd += ' -ovc xvid -xvidencopts'
00157             if qscale is not None:
00158                 cmd += ' fixed_quant=%s' % qscale
00159             else:
00160                 cmd += ' bitrate=%s:' % vbitrate
00161                 cmd += 'min_iquant=%s:max_iquant=%s:' % (qmin, qmax)
00162                 cmd += 'min_pquant=%s:max_pquant=%s:' % (qmin, qmax)
00163                 cmd += 'min_bquant=%s:max_bquant=%s' % (qmin, qmax)
00164         else:
00165             # mbd: macroblock decision
00166             cmd += ' -ovc lavc -lavcopts vcodec=%s:mbd=1' % vcodec
00167             if vbitrate is not None:
00168                 cmd += ':vbitrate=%s' % vbitrate
00169                 #cmd += ':vrc_minrate=%s:vrc_maxrate=%s' % ((vbitrate,)*2)
00170             if qscale is not None:
00171                 cmd += ':vqscale=%s' % qscale
00172             else:
00173                 cmd += ':vqmin=%s:vqmax=%s' % (qmin, qmax)
00174             if vbuffer is not None:
00175                 cmd += ':vrc_buf_size=%s' % vbuffer
00176         aspect = self._prop_prop['aspect']
00177         if aspect is not None:
00178             cmd += ':aspect=%s' % aspect
00179         #cmd += ' -oac copy' # audio
00180         size = self._get_size_get_size()
00181         if size is not None:
00182             cmd += ' -vf scale=%s:%s' % (size[0], size[1])
00183         # if no output file is given, use 'movie.avi' as default:
00184         if self._prop_prop['output_file'] is None: 
00185             self._prop_prop['output_file'] = 'movie.avi'
00186         output_file = self._prop_prop['output_file']
00187         if os.path.isfile(output_file) and not self._prop_prop['overwrite_output']:
00188             raise Exception, \
00189                   "Output file %s already exist. Use 'overwrite_output=True'" \
00190                   " to overwrite the file." % output_file
00191         cmd += ' -o %s' % output_file
00192         if self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00193             cmd += ' > /dev/null 2>&1'
00194         return cmd
00195 
00196     def _ffmpeg(self):
00197         """Create and return a string with commands for making a movie with the
00198         FFmpeg tool.
00199         """
00200         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00201         cmd = encoder
00202         files = self._prop_prop['input_files']
00203         file_type = self._prop_prop['file_type']
00204         if isinstance(files, str):
00205             pattern = r'(.*)%(\d+)d(.*\..*)'
00206             match = re.search(pattern, files)
00207             if match:
00208                 if file_type not in ['jpg', 'png'] or \
00209                        self._prop_prop['force_conversion']:
00210                     pre = match.group(1)
00211                     num = int(match.group(2))
00212                     ext = match.group(3)
00213                     files = pre + '[0-9]'*num + ext
00214                     files = glob.glob(files)
00215             else:
00216                 files = glob.glob(files)
00217         if isinstance(files, (list,tuple)):
00218             basename = 'tmp_'
00219             files = self._any2any_any2any(files, basename=basename, ofile_ext='.png')
00220             file_type = 'png'
00221             self._tmp_files_tmp_files = files[:]
00222             # create a new string with the right pattern:
00223             files = basename + '%04d.png'
00224         cmd += ' -i "%s"' % files
00225         cmd += ' -b %s' % self._prop_prop['vbitrate']
00226         cmd += ' -r %s' % self._prop_prop['fps']
00227         size = self._get_size_get_size()
00228         if size is not None:
00229             cmd += ' -s %sx%s' % size
00230         if self._prop_prop['vcodec'] is not None:
00231             cmd += ' -vcodec %s' % self._prop_prop['vcodec']
00232         if self._prop_prop['overwrite_output']:
00233             cmd += ' -y'
00234         if self._prop_prop['aspect'] is not None:
00235             cmd += ' -aspect %s' % self._prop_prop['aspect']
00236         if self._prop_prop['qscale'] is not None:
00237             cmd += ' -qscale %s' % self._prop_prop['qscale']
00238         else:
00239             cmd += ' -qmin %s -qmax %s' % \
00240                    (self._prop_prop['qmin'], self._prop_prop['qmax'])
00241         if self._prop_prop['vbuffer'] is not None:
00242             cmd += ' -bufsize %s' % self._prop_prop['vbuffer']
00243         if self._prop_prop['gop_size'] is not None:
00244             cmd += ' -g %d' % int(self._prop_prop['gop_size'])
00245         #cmd += ' -target dvd'
00246         # if no output file is given, use 'movie.avi' as default:
00247         if self._prop_prop['output_file'] is None: 
00248             self._prop_prop['output_file'] = 'movie.avi'
00249         cmd += ' ' + self._prop_prop['output_file']
00250         if self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00251             cmd += ' > /dev/null 2>&1'
00252         return cmd
00253 
00254     def _mpeg_encode(self):
00255         """Create and return a string with commands for creating a movie with
00256         the mpeg_encode tool.
00257         """
00258         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00259         basename = 'tmp_'  # basename for temporary files
00260 
00261         # set frame rate:
00262         # mpeg_encode only supports a given set of frame rates:
00263         legal_frame_rates = (23.976, 24, 25, 29.97, 30, 50 ,59.94, 60)
00264         if self._prop_prop['fps'] in legal_frame_rates:
00265             fps = self._prop_prop['fps']
00266         else:
00267             raise ValueError, \
00268                   "%s only supports the following frame rates: %s" % \
00269                   (encoder, legal_frame_rates)
00270 
00271         # set aspect ratio:
00272         legal_aspects = (1.0, 0.6735, 0.7031, 0.7615, 0.8055,
00273                          0.8437, 0.8935, 0.9157, 0.9815, 1.0255,
00274                          1.0695, 1.0950, 1.1575, 1.2015)
00275         aspect = self._prop_prop['aspect']
00276         if aspect is not None:
00277             if aspect not in legal_aspects:
00278                 raise ValueError, \
00279                       "%s only supports the following aspect ratios: %s" % \
00280                       (encoder, legal_aspects)
00281         else:
00282             aspect = 1.0
00283         print aspect
00284 
00285         # get image files:
00286         files = self._prop_prop['input_files']
00287         if isinstance(files, str):
00288             pattern = r'(.*)%(\d+)d(.*\..*)'
00289             match = re.search(pattern, files)
00290             if match:
00291                 pre = match.group(1)
00292                 num = int(match.group(2))
00293                 ext = match.group(3)
00294                 files = pre + '[0-9]'*num + ext
00295             files = glob.glob(files)
00296         if not files:
00297             raise ValueError, \
00298                   "%s is not a valid file specification or the files " \
00299                   "doesn't exist." % files
00300         size = self._get_size_get_size()
00301         if size is not None or self._prop_prop['file_type'] != 'pnm' or \
00302                self._prop_prop['force_conversion']:
00303             files = self._any2any_any2any(files, basename=basename, size=size)
00304             self._tmp_files_tmp_files = files[:]
00305         files = '\n'.join(files)
00306 
00307         # set input dir:
00308         input_dir = os.path.split(files[0])[0]
00309         if input_dir == '':
00310             input_dir = '.'
00311 
00312         # set output file:
00313         if self._prop_prop['output_file'] is None:
00314             self._prop_prop['output_file'] = 'movie.mpeg'
00315         mpeg_file = self._prop_prop['output_file']
00316         if os.path.isfile(mpeg_file) and not self._prop_prop['overwrite_output']:
00317             raise Exception, \
00318                   "Output file %s already exist. Use 'overwrite_output=True'" \
00319                   " to overwrite the file." % mpeg_file
00320 
00321         # set pattern (sequence of I, P, and B frames):
00322         pattern = self._prop_prop['pattern']
00323         if isinstance(pattern, str):
00324             pattern = pattern.upper()  # pattern must be uppercase
00325         else:
00326             # give warning?
00327             pattern = 'I'
00328 
00329         # set quantization scale for I, P, and B frames:
00330         qscale = self._prop_prop['qscale']
00331         iqscale = self._prop_prop['iqscale']
00332         pqscale = self._prop_prop['pqscale']
00333         bqscale = self._prop_prop['bqscale']
00334         if qscale is not None:
00335             if iqscale is None: iqscale = qscale
00336             if pqscale is None: pqscale = qscale
00337             if bqscale is None: bqscale = qscale
00338         else:
00339             if iqscale is None: iqscale = 8
00340             if pqscale is None: pqscale = 10
00341             if bqscale is None: bqscale = 25
00342 
00343         # set gop size:
00344         gop_size = self._prop_prop['gop_size']
00345         if gop_size is not None:
00346             gop_size = int(gop_size)
00347         else:
00348             gop_size = 15
00349 
00350         # create an mpeg_encode parameter file:
00351         mpeg_encode_file = "%s.mpeg_encode-input" % basename
00352         f = open(mpeg_encode_file, "w")
00353         f.write("""
00354 PATTERN          %(pattern)s
00355 OUTPUT           %(mpeg_file)s
00356 BASE_FILE_FORMAT PNM
00357 INPUT_CONVERT    *
00358 GOP_SIZE         %(gop_size)d
00359 #GOP_SIZE         16
00360 SLICES_PER_FRAME 1
00361 INPUT_DIR        %(input_dir)s
00362 INPUT
00363 %(files)s
00364 END_INPUT
00365 PIXEL            FULL
00366 #PIXEL            HALF
00367 RANGE            10
00368 PSEARCH_ALG      LOGARITHMIC
00369 BSEARCH_ALG      CROSS2
00370 IQSCALE          %(iqscale)d
00371 PQSCALE          %(pqscale)d
00372 BQSCALE          %(bqscale)d
00373 REFERENCE_FRAME  ORIGINAL
00374 FRAME_RATE       %(fps)d
00375 ASPECT_RATIO     %(aspect)s
00376 FORCE_ENCODE_LAST_FRAME
00377 """ % vars())
00378         
00379         # set video bit rate and buffer size:
00380         vbitrate = self._prop_prop['vbitrate']
00381         if isinstance(vbitrate, (float,int)):
00382             f.write("BIT_RATE         %d" % (int(vbitrate)*1000))
00383         vbuffer = self._prop_prop['vbuffer']
00384         if isinstance(vbuffer, (float,int)):
00385             f.write("BUFFER_SIZE      %d" % (int(vbuffer)*1000))
00386         f.close()
00387         
00388         if not hasattr(self, '_tmp_files'):
00389             self._tmp_files_tmp_files = []
00390         self._tmp_files_tmp_files.append(mpeg_encode_file)
00391 
00392         # create the command string:
00393         cmd = encoder
00394         if self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00395             cmd += ' -realquiet'
00396         cmd += ' ' + mpeg_encode_file
00397         return cmd
00398 
00399     # mpeg_encode and ppmtompeg is the same encoding tool:
00400     _ppmtompeg = _mpeg_encode
00401 
00402     def _mpeg2enc(self):
00403         """Create and return a string with commands for making a movie with
00404         the mpeg2enc tool (from MJPEGTools).
00405         """
00406         encoder = self._prop_prop['encoder']
00407         png2yuv = 'png2yuv'
00408         jpeg2yuv = 'jpeg2yuv'
00409         yuvscaler = 'yuvscaler'
00410         
00411         file_type = self._prop_prop['file_type']
00412         files = self._prop_prop['input_files']
00413         if isinstance(files, str):
00414             pattern = r'(.*)%(\d+)d(.*\..*)'
00415             match = re.search(pattern, files)
00416             if match:
00417                 if file_type not in ['jpg', 'png'] or \
00418                        self._prop_prop['force_conversion']:
00419                     pre = match.group(1)
00420                     num = int(match.group(2))
00421                     ext = match.group(3)
00422                     files = pre + '[0-9]'*num + ext
00423                     files = glob.glob(files)
00424             else:
00425                 files = glob.glob(files)
00426         if isinstance(files, (list,tuple)):
00427             basename = 'tmp_'
00428             files = self._any2any_any2any(files, basename=basename, ofile_ext='.png')
00429             file_type = 'png'
00430             self._tmp_files_tmp_files = files[:]
00431             # create a new string with the right pattern:
00432             files = basename + '%04d.png'
00433             
00434         cmd = ''
00435         if file_type == 'jpg' and findprograms(jpeg2yuv):
00436             cmd += jpeg2yuv
00437         elif findprograms(png2yuv):
00438             cmd += png2yuv
00439         else:
00440             raise Exception, "png2yuv or jpeg2yuv is not installed"
00441         cmd += ' -f 25' # frame rate
00442         cmd += ' -I p'  # interlacing mode: p = none / progressive
00443         cmd += ' -j "%s"' % files # set image files
00444         # find start image:
00445         for i in xrange(9999):
00446             if os.path.isfile(files % i):
00447                 cmd += ' -b %d' % i
00448                 break
00449         if self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00450             cmd += ' -v 0' # verbosity level 0
00451 
00452         # set size of movie (by using the yuvscaler tool):
00453         size = self._get_size_get_size()
00454         if size is not None and findprograms(yuvscaler):
00455             width, height = size
00456             cmd += ' | %(yuvscaler)s -O SIZE_%(width)sx%(height)s' % vars()
00457 
00458         # if no output file is given, use 'movie.avi' as default:
00459         if self._prop_prop['output_file'] is None: 
00460             self._prop_prop['output_file'] = 'movie.mpeg'
00461         output_file = self._prop_prop['output_file']
00462         if os.path.isfile(output_file) and not self._prop_prop['overwrite_output']:
00463             raise Exception, \
00464                   "Output file %s already exist. Use 'overwrite_output=True'" \
00465                   " to overwrite the file." % output_file
00466 
00467         cmd += ' | '
00468         cmd += encoder
00469         if self._prop_prop['vcodec'] == 'mpeg2video':
00470             cmd += ' -f 3' # generic mpeg-2 video
00471         else:
00472             cmd += ' -f 0' # generic mpeg-1 video
00473         if self._prop_prop['vbitrate'] is not None:
00474             cmd += ' -b %d' % int(self._prop_prop['vbitrate'])
00475         if self._prop_prop['vbuffer'] is not None:
00476             cmd += ' -V %d' % int(self._prop_prop['vbuffer'])
00477         if self._prop_prop['qscale'] is not None:
00478             cmd += ' -q %s' % self._prop_prop['qscale']
00479 
00480         # set movie frame rate:
00481         legal_fps = {'23.976': 1, '24': 2, '25': 3, '29.97': 4,
00482                      '30': 5, '50': 6, '59.94': 7, '60': 8}
00483         fps = str(self._prop_prop['fps'])
00484         if not fps in legal_fps:
00485             raise ValueError, "fps must be %s, not %s" % \
00486                   (fps_convert.keys(), fps)
00487         cmd += ' -F %s' % legal_fps[fps]
00488         #cmd += ' --cbr' # constant bit rate
00489         gop_size = self._prop_prop['gop_size']
00490         if gop_size is not None:
00491             # set min (-g) and max (-G) gop size to the same value:
00492             cmd += ' -g %s -G %s' % (gop_size, gop_size)
00493 
00494         # set aspect ratio:
00495         legal_aspects = {'1.0': 1, '1.3': 2, '1.7': 3, '2.21': 4}
00496         aspect = self._get_aspect_ratio_get_aspect_ratio()
00497         if aspect is not None:
00498             if aspect not in legal_aspects.values():
00499                 aspect = str(aspect)
00500                 for key in legal_aspects.keys():
00501                     if aspect.startswith(key):
00502                         aspect = legal_aspects[key]
00503                         break
00504                 if aspect not in legal_aspects.values():
00505                     raise ValueError, \
00506                           "aspect must be either 1:1, 4:3, 16:9, or 2.21:1," \
00507                           " not %s" % aspect
00508             cmd += ' -a %s' % aspect
00509 
00510         # set output file:
00511         cmd += ' -o %s' % self._prop_prop['output_file']
00512         if self._prop_prop['quiet']:
00513             cmd += ' -v 0' # verbosity level 0 (warnings and errors only)
00514         return cmd
00515 
00516     def _any2any(self, files, basename='tmp_', size=None, ofile_ext='.pnm'):
00517         # Converts a list of files to the file format specified in the
00518         # ofile_ext keyword argument. Using either Netpbm tools or convert
00519         # (from the ImageMagick package).
00520         netpbm_converters = {'.png': ('pngtopnm', 'pnmtopng'),
00521                              '.gif': ('giftopnm',  'ppmtogif'),
00522                              '.jpg': ('jpegtopnm', 'pnmtojpeg'),
00523                              '.ps':  ('pstopnm', 'pnmtops'),
00524                              '.eps': ('pstopnm', 'pnmtops'),
00525                              '.bmp': ('bmptopnm', 'ppmtobmp'),
00526                              '.tif': ('tifftopnm', 'pnmtotiff'),
00527                              '.tga': ('tgatopnm', 'ppmtotga'),
00528                              '.pnm': ('cat', ''),
00529                              }
00530         _check_type(files, 'files', (list,tuple))
00531         ifile_ext = os.path.splitext(files[0])[1]
00532         anytopnm = netpbm_converters[ifile_ext][0]
00533         pnmtoany = netpbm_converters[ofile_ext][1]
00534         pnmscale = 'pnmscale'
00535         #pnmcrop = 'pnmcrop'
00536         convert = 'convert'
00537         
00538         app = anytopnm
00539         if findprograms((convert, anytopnm, pnmtoany)):
00540             if self._prop_prop['prefered_package'].lower() == 'imagemagick':
00541                 app = convert
00542         elif findprograms(convert):
00543             app = convert
00544         elif not findprograms((anytopnm, pnmtoany)):
00545             raise Exception, "neither %s nor %s was found" % (convert,anytopnm)
00546         
00547         quiet = self._prop_prop['quiet']
00548         new_files = []
00549         i = 1 # counter
00550         for file_ in files:
00551             new_file = "%s%04d%s" % (basename, i, ofile_ext)
00552             if app == anytopnm:
00553                 options = ''
00554                 if quiet and app != 'cat':
00555                     options += '-quiet'
00556                 if app == 'pstopnm':
00557                     options += ' -stdout'
00558                     options += ' -portrait'
00559                 cmd = "%(app)s %(options)s %(file_)s " % vars()
00560                 if size is not None and findprograms(pnmscale):
00561                     w, h = size
00562                     cmd += "| %(pnmscale)s -width %(w)s -height %(h)s" % vars()
00563                 if pnmtoany != '':
00564                     options = ''
00565                     if quiet:
00566                         options += '-quiet'
00567                     if pnmtoany == 'pnmtojpeg':
00568                         options += ' -quality 100' # don't lose quality
00569                     cmd += " | %(pnmtoany)s %(options)s" % vars()
00570                 cmd += " > %s" % new_file
00571             else:
00572                 options = ''
00573                 if size is not None:
00574                     options += '-resize %sx%s' % size
00575                 cmd = "%(app)s %(options)s %(file_)s %(new_file)s" % vars()
00576             if not quiet: 
00577                 print cmd
00578             failure = os.system(cmd)
00579             if failure:
00580                 print "....%s failed, jumping to next file..." % app
00581                 continue
00582             new_files.append(new_file)
00583             if not quiet:
00584                 apps = app
00585                 if app != convert and pnmtoany != '':
00586                     apps += ' and %s' % pnmtoany
00587                 print "%s transformed via %s to %s (%d Kb)" % \
00588                       (file_,apps,new_file,int(os.path.getsize(new_file)/1000))
00589             i += 1
00590 
00591         return new_files
00592 
00593     def _get_aspect_ratio(self):
00594         # accept aspect ratio on the form 4:3, 4/3, or 1.3333
00595         aspect = self._prop_prop['aspect']
00596         if isinstance(aspect, str):
00597             if aspect.find(':') > 0:
00598                 aspect = aspect.split(':')
00599             elif aspect.find('/'):
00600                 aspect = aspect.split('/')
00601             else:
00602                 try: aspect = float(aspect)
00603                 except: aspect = None
00604             try: aspect = float(aspect[0]) / float(aspect[1])
00605             except: aspect = None
00606         return aspect
00607 
00608     def _get_size(self):
00609         legal_sizes = {'sqcif': (128, 96),
00610                        'qcif': (176, 144),
00611                        'cif': (352, 288),
00612                        '4cif': (704, 576)}
00613         size = self._prop_prop['size']
00614         if isinstance(size, str):
00615             if size in legal_sizes:
00616                 size = legal_sizes[size]
00617             else:
00618                 size = size.split('x') # wxh
00619         if not (isinstance(size, (tuple,list)) and len(size) == 2):
00620             size = None
00621         return size            
00622 
00623 
00624 def movie(input_files, **kwargs):
00625     """
00626     Make a movie from a series of image files. 
00627 
00628     Input arguments:
00629 
00630     input_files -- This argument specifies the image files which will be used
00631                    to make the movie. The arguemnt must be given as either a
00632                    string (eg. 'image_*.png') or a list/tuple of strings
00633                    (eg. glob.glob('image_*.png').
00634 
00635                    Note:
00636                    
00637                    - When using the FFmpeg or the Mpeg2enc tools, the image
00638                      files should be given (if possible) as a string with
00639                      the format '{1}%{2}d{3}' where the name componentes are
00640                      as follows:
00641                      
00642                        {1} filename prefix (eg. image_)
00643                        {2} counting placeholder (like in C, printf, eg. 04)
00644                        {3} file extension (eg. .png or .jpg)
00645 
00646                      A correct description of the files could look like
00647                      this: 'image_%04d.png'
00648 
00649                    - If the image files is not given on the correct format (as
00650                      described above), there will be made copies which will
00651                      then be renamed to the required filename format. This will
00652                      extend the creation time of the movie.
00653                      
00654                    - MEncdoer, FFmpeg, and Mpeg2enc supports only .jpg and .png
00655                      image files, so if another file format is used, there will
00656                      be made copies which in turn will be converted to the
00657                      correct format.
00658     
00659     Keyword arguments:
00660 
00661     output_file -- Sets the name of the output movie. If not set, a default
00662                    name like 'movie.avi' (or 'movie.mpeg' depending on the
00663                    output format) will be given.
00664 
00665     overwrite_output -- If this is True, the file given in the output_file
00666                    (above) will be overwritten without warning (if it exists).
00667                    The default is False.
00668     
00669     encoder     -- Sets the encoder tool to be used. Currently the following
00670                    encoders are supported: 'mencoder', 'ffmpeg', 'mpeg_encode',
00671                    'ppmtompeg' (from the Netpbm package), and 'mpeg2enc' (from
00672                    the MJPEGTools package).
00673 
00674                    Note: ppmtompeg and mpeg_encode is the same tool.
00675       
00676     vbitrate    -- Sets the bit rate of the movie . The default is 800 kbps.
00677 
00678     vbuffer     -- Sets the video buffer size. The default is to use the 
00679                    current encoding tools default video buffer size. In some
00680                    cases it might be necessary to push this up to 500K or more.
00681        
00682     fps         -- Sets the number of frames per second for the final movie.
00683                    The default is 25 fps.
00684 
00685                    Note: the mpeg_encode, ppmtompeg, and mpeg2enc tool only
00686                    supports the following frame rates: 23.976, 24, 25, 29.97,
00687                    30, 50, 59.94, and 60 fps.
00688 
00689     vcodec      -- Sets the video codec to be used. Some of the possible codecs
00690                    are:
00691 
00692                    'mjpeg'      - Motion JPEG
00693                    'ljpeg'      - Lossless JPEG
00694                    'h263'       - H.263
00695                    'h263p'      - H.263+
00696                    'mpeg4'      - MPEG-4 (DivX 4/5)
00697                    'msmpeg4'    - DivX 3
00698                    'msmpeg4v2'  - DivX 3
00699                    'msmpeg4v2'  - MS MPEG4v2
00700                    'wmv1'       - Windows Media Video, version 1 (AKA WMV7)
00701                    'wmv2'       - Windows Media Video, version 2 (AKA WMV8)
00702                    'rv10'       - an old RealVideo codec
00703                    'mpeg1video' - MPEG-1 video
00704                    'mpeg2video' - MPEG-2 video
00705                    'huffyuv'    - HuffYUV
00706                    'ffvhuff'    - nonstandard 20% smaller HuffYUV using YV12
00707                    'asv1'       - ASUS Video v1
00708                    'asv2'       - ASUS Video v2
00709                    'ffv1'       - FFmpeg's lossless video codec
00710 
00711                    The default codec is 'mpeg4' for mencoder/ffmpeg and
00712                    'mpeg1video' for mpeg2enc.
00713 
00714                    Note:
00715                    
00716                    - Run 'ffmpeg -formats' for a longer list of available
00717                      codecs.
00718 
00719                    - The mencoder tool can also use the 'xvid' codec.
00720 
00721                    - Only 'mpeg1video' and 'mpeg2video' is available when
00722                      using the mpeg2enc tool. 
00723 
00724                    - For the mpeg_encode (and ppmtompeg) encoding tool this
00725                      option has no effect. 
00726 
00727     qscale      -- The quantization scale value (qscale) give a trade-off
00728                    between quality and compression. A lower value means better
00729                    quality but larger files. Lager values gives better
00730                    compression, but worse quality. The qscale value must be an
00731                    integer between 1 and 31.
00732                    The default is to not set the qscale option, that is
00733                    qscale=None.
00734 
00735                    Note: For the mpeg_encode and ppmtompeg tools, it is
00736                    possible to have different qscale for I, P, and B frames
00737                    (see iqscale, pqscale, and bqscale below).
00738 
00739     qmin        -- Minimum quantization scale value. Integer between 1 and 31.
00740                    Default is 2.
00741 
00742     qmax        -- Maximum quantization scale value. Integer between 1 and 31.
00743                    Default is 31.
00744 
00745     iqscale     -- Sets the quantization scale (see qscale) for I frames.
00746                    Only affects mpeg_encode and ppmtompeg. The default is to
00747                    use the same value as in qscale. If qscale is None, then 8
00748                    is default value for iqscale.
00749                    
00750     pqscale     -- Same as iqscale, but for P frames. If qscale is None, then
00751                    10 is default value for pqscale.
00752     
00753     bqscale     -- Same as iqscale, but for B frames. If qscale is None, then
00754                    25 is default valie for bqscale.
00755 
00756     pattern     -- Sets the pattern (sequence) of I frames, P frames, and B
00757                    frames. The default pattern is 'I' which gives good quality
00758                    (but worse compression). Another standard sequence is
00759                    'IBBPBBPBBPBBPBB'.
00760 
00761                    Note: this option only effects the mpeg_encode and ppmtompeg
00762                    encoding tools.
00763        
00764     size        -- Sets the size of the movie. The size must be given as
00765                    either a tuple/list, like (width, height), or as a string.
00766                    The format of the string must be 'wxh' (eg. '320x240'), but
00767                    the following abbreviations are also recognized:
00768 
00769                    'sqcif' - 128x96
00770                    'qcif'  - 176x144
00771                    'cif'   - 352x288
00772                    '4cif'  - 704x576
00773 
00774                    The default is to use the size of the input images.
00775 
00776     aspect      -- Sets the aspect ratio of the movie (eg. 4/3 or 16/9).
00777 
00778                    Note:
00779                    
00780                    - mpeg_encode and ppmtompeg only supports the following
00781                      aspect ratios: 1.0, 0.6735, 0.7031, 0.7615,0.8055, 0.8437,
00782                      0.8935, 0.9157, 0.9815, 1.0255, 1.0695, 1.0950, 1.1575,
00783                      and 1.2015.
00784 
00785                    - mpeg2enc only supports the following aspect ratios: 1.0,
00786                      1.33, 1.77, and 2.21.
00787 
00788     prefered_package -- Sets whether to prefer the Netpbm package or the
00789                   ImageMagick package if both of them are installed. Must be
00790                   given as a string, that is either 'imagemagick' or 'netpbm'.
00791                   The default is to use ImageMagick.
00792 
00793                   Note:
00794 
00795                   - If only one of the packages is installed, then that package
00796                     will be used.
00797 
00798                   - If none of the packages is installed, then some operations
00799                     might stop in lack of needed programs.
00800 
00801     gop_size    -- Sets the number of frames in a group of pictures (GOP). The
00802                    default is to use the current encoder tools default value.
00803        
00804     quiet       -- If this is True, then the operations will run quietly and
00805                    only complain on errors. Default is False.
00806 
00807     force_conversion -- Force conversion of images. This is a hack which can
00808                    be used if the encoding tool has problems reading the input
00809                    image files. If this is True, the images will be converted
00810                    even if the they are in a format recognized by the encoding
00811                    tool. Default is False.
00812 
00813     Examples:
00814     
00815     Create a movie (with default values) from a series of png image files named
00816     img001.png, img002.png, img003.png, ... in the current working directory:
00817 
00818     >>> import easyviz, glob
00819     >>> images = glob.glob('img*.png')
00820     >>> py4cs.easyviz.movie(images)
00821 
00822     or equivalently:
00823 
00824     >>> py4cs.easyviz.movie('img*.png')
00825 
00826     Create a movie from a series of jpeg files named img01.jpg, img02.jpg, ...
00827     which lies in the folder /tmp/images using the FFmpeg encoder, with video
00828     codec 'mpeg2video', video bit rate 2400 kbps, size 320x240, quantization
00829     scale 4, 25 frames per second, and store the movie in a file called
00830     movie.avi in the current directory:
00831     
00832     >>> easiviz.movie('/tmp/images/img%02d.jpg',
00833     ...               encoder='ffmpeg',
00834     ...               vcodec='mpeg2video',
00835     ...               vbitrate=2400,
00836     ...               size='320x240',
00837     ...               qscale=4,
00838     ...               fps=25)
00839     ...               output_file='movie.avi')
00840 
00841     """
00842     me = MovieEncoder(input_files, **kwargs)
00843     me.encode()
00844 
00845 
00846 if __name__ == '__main__':
00847     pass
